raw_comment:
1. 
I notice that the more income from the parent the likelihood you will be accepted increases.
2. 
I wonder what the test score is that they are comparing? How does that compare to the average?
3. 
This impacts me and the community I am in because of the people who are applying to colleges right now and deciding on what is “worth applying to.” stats like this make students not even want to apply in far of rejection compared to their “richer” peers.
4. 
Daddy’s money and how it can help you get into college.
ace_sentences: A higher income of a parent increases the likelihood that a student will be accepted.
I wonder which test score they compare.
I wonder how this test score compares to the average test score.
Some people in my community apply to colleges now.
Some people in my community decide now which colleges are worth applying to.
Such statistics make some students not want to apply to some colleges.
Some students compare themselves to richer peers.
The money of a father can help a student get into college.
